title: 73/9. Report of the International Atomic Energy Agency
text:
United Nations 
A/RES/73/9
 
 
General Assembly 
Distr.: General 
12 November 2018 
 
18-19052 (E)    141118     
*1819052* 
 
 
Seventy-third session 
Agenda item 92 
 
 
 
 
 Resolution adopted by the General Assembly 
on 9 November 2018 
 
 
 
 
[without reference to a Main Committee (A/73/L.19 and A/73/L.19/Add.1)] 
 
 
 
73/9. Report of the International Atomic Energy Agency 
 
 
 
The General Assembly,  
 
Having received the report of the International Atomic Energy Agency for 2017, 1 
 
Taking note of the statement by the Director General of the Agency, in which he 
provided additional information on the main developments in the activities of the 
Agency during 2018, 
 
Recognizing the importance of the work of the Agency,  
 
Recognizing also the cooperation between the United Nations and the Agency and 
the Agreement governing the relationship between the United Nations and the Agency 
as approved by the General Conference of the Agency on 23 October 1957 and by the 
General Assembly in the annex to its resolution 1145 (XII) of 14 November 1957,  
 
1. 
Takes note with appreciation of the report of the International Atomic 
Energy Agency;1 
 
2. 
Takes note of resolutions GC(62)/RES/6 on nuclear and radiation safety; 
GC(62)/RES/7 on nuclear security; GC(62)/RES/8 on the strengthening of the 
Agency’s technical cooperation activities; GC(62)/RES/9 on strengthening the 
Agency’s activities related to nuclear science, technology and applications, 
comprising GC(62)/RES/9 A on non-power nuclear applications, GC(62)/RES/9 B on 
nuclear power applications and GC(62)/RES/9 C on nuclear knowledge management; 
GC(62)/RES/10 on strengthening the effectiveness and improving the efficiency of 
Agency safeguards; GC(62)/RES/11 on the implementation of the Treaty on the 
Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons safeguards agreement between the Agency and 
the Democratic People’s Republic of Korea; and GC(62)/RES/12 on the application 
of Agency safeguards in the Middle East; and decisions GC(62)/DEC/10 on the 
amendment to article XIV.A of the statute of the Agency; and GC(62)/DEC/11 on the 
__________________ 
 
1  See A/73/315. 

A/RES/73/9 
Report of the International Atomic Energy Agency
 
18-19052
2/2 
 
promotion of the efficiency and effectiveness of the Agency’s decision-making 
process, adopted by the General Conference of the Agency at its sixty-second regular 
session, held from 17 to 21 September 2018;  
 
3. 
Reaffirms its strong support for the indispensable role of the Agency in 
encouraging and assisting the development and practical application of atomic energy 
for peaceful uses, in technology transfer to developing countries and in nuclear safety, 
verification and security;  
 
4. 
Appeals to Member States to continue to support the activities of the 
Agency;  
 
5. 
Requests the Secretary-General to transmit to the Director General of the 
Agency the records of the seventy-third session of the General Assembly relating to 
the activities of the Agency. 
 
34th plenary meeting  
9 November 2018

paragraphs.1: Takes note with appreciation of the report of the International Atomic Energy Agency;1
paragraphs.2: Takes note of resolutions GC(62)/RES/6 on nuclear and radiation safety; GC(62)/RES/7 on nuclear security; GC(62)/RES/8 on the strengthening of the Agency’s technical cooperation activities; GC(62)/RES/9 on strengthening the Agency’s activities related to nuclear science, technology and applications, comprising GC(62)/RES/9 A on non-power nuclear applications, GC(62)/RES/9 B on nuclear power applications and GC(62)/RES/9 C on nuclear knowledge management; GC(62)/RES/10 on strengthening the effectiveness and improving the efficiency of Agency safeguards; GC(62)/RES/11 on the implementation of the Treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons safeguards agreement between the Agency and the Democratic People’s Republic of Korea; and GC(62)/RES/12 on the application of Agency safeguards in the Middle East; and decisions GC(62)/DEC/10 on the amendment to article XIV.A of the statute of the Agency; and GC(62)/DEC/11 on the promotion of the efficiency and effectiveness of the Agency’s decision-making process, adopted by the General Conference of the Agency at its sixty-second regular session, held from 17 to 21 September 2018;
paragraphs.3: Reaffirms its strong support for the indispensable role of the Agency in encouraging and assisting the development and practical application of atomic energy for peaceful uses, in technology transfer to developing countries and in nuclear safety, verification and security;
paragraphs.4: Appeals to Member States to continue to support the activities of the Agency;
paragraphs.5: Requests the Secretary-General to transmit to the Director General of the Agency the records of the seventy-third session of the General Assembly relating to the activities of the Agency.
